physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient appeared toxic and febrile. Microcephaly with a head circumference of 36.5 cm (<3rd percentile). Failure to thrive with height of 58 cm (-3.0 SD) and weight of 4.7 Kg (-3.7 SD), both under the 3rd percentile. Hoarseness noted. Lung auscultation revealed rhonchi and wheezing. Erythema and swelling at the BCG vaccine injection site, which resolved after 10 days. Oral candidiasis, pustular rash on fingers, and multiple perianal punched-out ulcers observed. No facial dysmorphism, hepatosplenomegaly, or lymphadenopathy detected.
